decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly and efficiently in order to cast spells like Burning Wish and Empty the Warrens to win the game. The deck utilizes cards like Rite of Flame, Seething Song, and Lotus Petal to generate mana, while also including fast mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond and Chrome Mox. Once enough mana is generated, the deck aims to combo off using Goblin Charbelcher or create a large number of goblin tokens with Empty the Warrens to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Rishadan Port to slow down the opponent's mana development, the deck aims to control the board and maintain a tempo advantage. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to enhance its creatures and win through combat damage. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan while steadily building a board presence to secure a victory.

The main objective is to quickly put Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play by using Show and Tell along with Omniscience to bypass its high casting cost. The deck is heavily focused on card selection and manipulation, using cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, Preordain, and Drawn from Dreams to dig through the deck and find the necessary combo pieces. The deck also includes counter spells like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. Additionally, Boseiju, Who Shelters All is included to ensure that Show and Tell resolves uninterrupted.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Arcum's Astrolabe, along with efficient creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Snapcaster Mage. The win condition is to either resolve a big threat like Entreat the Angels or overwhelm the opponent with efficient beaters like Oko, Thief of Crowns. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements while maximizing consistency and flexibility.

The main idea of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to use aggressive creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Blood Sun and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's strategies, while cards like Punishing Fire and Fiery Confluence provide removal and direct damage. The inclusion of cards like Hazoret the Fervent and Goblin Rabblemaster provide additional threats and a quick clock to pressure the opponent. The deck aims to establish early board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on assembling a large number of Elf creatures using cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Glimpse of Nature, which generates card advantage and mana to ramp up quickly. This enables the player to search for key cards like Craterhoof Behemoth to create a massive creature swarm that overwhelms the opponent in one big attack. The deck also utilizes cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to untap and reuse key mana-producing Elves, ensuring a steady stream of resources to fuel the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Dark Depths combo quickly and efficiently to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. This is accomplished through cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Thespian's Stage. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Duress to protect the combo and deal with opposing threats. Additionally, cards like Vampire Hexmage and Pithing Needle provide additional utility and protection for the combo. Ultimately, the goal is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo and overwhelm the opponent with the powerful Marit Lage token.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on accelerating out powerful Eldrazi creatures early in the game using mana acceleration like Eldrazi Temple, Ancient Tomb, and Simian Spirit Guide. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt opponents' game plans, while Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher provide powerful disruption and aggression on the board. With a mix of aggressive beaters and disruptive creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently before they can establish their game plan.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost threats like Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Dreadhorde Arcanist while supporting them with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt, Brainstorm, and Daze to control the board and push through damage quickly. Force of Will and Force of Negation provide protection for your creatures and disruption against your opponent's spells. Oko, Thief of Crowns can help deal with problematic permanents and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The mana base is designed to support casting your spells efficiently and consistently. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain momentum throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Underworld Breach along with Brain Freeze to mill your own deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes various fast mana accelerants like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, along with card selection tools like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to help set up the combo. The inclusion of disruption spells like Force of Will and Pact of Negation, as well as defensive cards like Defense Grid and Orim's Chant, helps protect the combo from opponents' interaction.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent and control the board state. It combines elements of aggressive creature strategies with disruptive elements to create a versatile and powerful deck. By using cards like Mother of Runes, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Knight of the Reliquary, the deck aims to quickly establish a threatening presence on the battlefield while using cards like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruptive spells.

The main idea of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Grim Monolith and Seething Song, then use Sneak Attack to bring out powerful dragons like Drakuseth and Thundermaw Hellkite. With cards like Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon disrupting the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to hit hard and fast, overwhelming the opponent with aggressive dragon creatures. Utilizing Zirilan of the Claw's ability to search for dragons, the deck looks to apply pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.
